resources.string: Do this without asking next time

You have overridden the project config path. Please keep in mind that abusing this feature in order to gain write access on the wiki, where you wouldn't normally have it, may result in a permanent block of your account.
The message to $2 cannot be sent, as instant warnings are not enabled on project $1. Please pick a different warning level.
Revert as a good faith edit with a custom reason
$1 with score $2 on $3 has been whitelisted
Waiting for queries that perform edits to end...
There is no page to display yet.
Downloading diff using a MW fallback, please wait...
Send message to target user with explanation for block
Note: $1 is tagged as a shared or dynamic IP address.
$1 is already affected by a rangeblock on $2.\nThis block will override the effect of the rangeblock. Continue?
No user info was present in the query (are you an admin?)
There is no user selected to block.
This shortcut is already being used by $1, please pick a different one
Open browser links in a new browser window
Show new edits to the selected page as they are made
Use IRC feed for recent changes if possible
Require confirmation for reverting an edit that was made in user space
Require confirmation for reverting an edit that was made by whitelisted user
Require confirmation for reverting talk page
Send a welcome message to users who have empty talk pages on good edits
Automatically resolve edit conflicts with other users who reverted or changed the same page
Use instant reverts (very fast, but can't be cancelled once executed)
On revert of multiple edits by same user:
Revert edits to pages that are newer than the displayed diff if they were made by the same vandalizing user
Change all Huggle settings to behave more like Huggle 2
Merge your messages with others in existing sections
Use months as headers instead of the name of a page
Use automatic warning type and level on "send warning" function
Remove edits that were already reverted by someone else from the queue
Remove older edits from the queue if a newer edit to same page is received
Automatically load history and user info (requires extra network bandwidth)
Switch to the latest revision of the page in case the currently loaded edit is not the latest revision (will post-download it, making Huggle slower)
Require a delay after every load of the next edit, during which it will not be possible to use any write feature (useful for avoiding keyboard multi-press bug)
The delay, in seconds, until write features are enabled:
Make the columns of lists either dynamic (will resize based on size of items) or manual (user can change their size)
Display a notification when you receive a new message on your talk page
Page title in every diff (large text that shows just the page title on top of every diff)
Project configuration (list of warning types) was changed since your last visit, shortcuts for dropdown menus (revert and warn, etc.) were reset.
HAN can render HTML messages (NOTE: It's potentially dangerous)
Highlight summary when present instead of when it's missing
Confirm revert multiple versions of an edit by the same user
Confirm reversion to an edit by the user being reverted
Confirm reversion of own edits (except undo)
Confirm reversion to an edit by a warned user
Confirm reversion to edits by anonymous users in the same /16 range as the user being reverted
After reverting, move to the next edit in the queue
Automatically refresh page in case there was another edit made to it
When asked to warn a user with a final warning
Prompt for block if asked to warn a user with a final warning
Download the whole history of all articles
Shortcut '$1' conflicts with the existing shortcut for '$1'.
You can't use : in the name of a queue
Check for beta versions if available
Edit summary (Huggle suffix will be automatically inserted)

There was no token returned by the query
No page info was present in query (are you an admin?)
Unfortunately Huggle has crashed. Please submit the following information together with details of what were you doing to
This is not the latest revision of this page. Make sure you have reviewed the newer versions as well. Please also keep in mind that a rollback may not be possible from this point.

This item can't be undone. The page might have been changed or deleted meanwhile, and Huggle is unable to perform an undo from this point. If you really want to undo it, you will need to do that by hand using the MediaWiki interface.

Reload a list of available projects that can be used in Huggle. This can be useful in case you want to use Huggle in a project in which the tool was recently enabled.
Remember this setting for next time
Huggle may need to be restarted for these changes to take effect.

This user has already reached warning level 4, so no further templates will be delivered to them. You can report them now, but please make sure that they already reached the proper number of recent warnings! You can do so by clicking the "talk page" button in the following form. Keep in mind that this form and this warning are displayed whether your revert was successful or not, so you might conflict with other users here (double check that the user isn't already reported). Do you want to report this user?
You are going to report user $1
Please select a diff in the list in order to open the preview
This user is not reported now
No diffs were provided as evidence. This will make it very hard for administrators to figure out whether the user is a vandal or not. Are you sure you want to continue?
The user has already been reported
Error: Unable to retrieve report page at $1
Matches any word on non-talk pages
Matches only whole words on non-talk pages
Matches any word that contains this string
You requested to use SSL, but unfortunately, $1 doesn't support it.
The webserver of $1 requires that SSL is to be enabled. Please turn SSL on and try again. If you can't enable SSL (option is grayed out) you may need to install OpenSSL libraries to your system.
The "Usernames for administrator attention" noticeboard is not available on your wiki.
This user has already been reported to UAA.
This user is not reported to UAA.
You didn't specify a reason as to why the username is a policy violation. Please specify a reason.
The query for the page contents returned no data.

Failed to retrieve deletion log for $1
This edit is a top revision
Undoing own edit, which was made to $1
No item is selected in history widget
Do you really want to undo just this message?
Another edit is already being undone, please wait...

This was a message that is referenced by a rollback, are you sure you want to undo only template and not even your edit to page? (you need to undo the rollback in case you want to revert both of these)
Unable to undo your edit to $1 as the following error was encountered: $2
Unable to retrieve the content of page which we wanted to undo our own edit. Error was: $1
You created this talk page, so it can't be undone. Do you want to replace it with a welcome template?

Tabs in Huggle work in a similar way as in any other web browser. All tabs within Huggle share the same queue, but they are useful in case you want to keep an eye on certain page, or if you want to check an edit later.

Unable to retrieve the previous content of page: $1
You can't use both Append and Prepend for editing a page
Unable to edit $1 because token I had in cache is no longer valid. Please try to edit that page once more

Display this message also next time you launch Huggle

Huggle was unable to retrieve the contents of user talk page, are you sure you want to send a welcome message to them?
Conflict resolved: reverted all edits, including new edits. Edits were by the same user: $1.
Conflict resolved: reverted all edits including new edits, made by the same users: $1
Conflict resolved: did not perform any action - there are newer edits to $1
Conflict resolved: do not perform any action - there are multiple edits by the same user to $1
Conflict resolved: revert all edits - there are multiple edits by the same user to $1
There are multiple edits to $1 by the same user, are you sure you want to revert them?
There are newer edits to $1. Are you sure you really want to revert them?
There are newer edits made to $1 by a different user. Are you sure you want to revert them all? (It will likely fail anyway because it will have an old token.)
Show warning if you are not on last revision of page
You can't delete a filter that is currently being used
This extension is already scheduled for disabling on the next startup of Huggle
Extension was set to be disabled on the next startup of Huggle
This extension is not scheduled for disabling on the next startup of Huggle
Extension was enabled. You will need to restart Huggle for it to take effect.
Watch the talk page of a user who received a warning from you
Play sound when a new item is added to the queue
Play sound when a message is received in HAN
Enable category scans and watch status filtering (requires an extra API query per edit)
Enable global max score (edits with higher score will be ignored - useful if you want to see only good edits)
Enable global min score (edits with lower score will be ignored - useful if you want to see only bad edits)
This will restore factory layout of huggle as it had when you installed it. Huggle will shut down. Continue?
Prevent repeated keystrokes by following rate in miliseconds (only 1 same shortcut can be triggered within N ms)
Unable to retrieve the current report page: $1
Unable to retrieve the current report page because the query didn't return any text for this page
The query didn't return any timestamp. This may be a MediaWiki bug. Aborting the query
There is no description for this tag
Unable to tag the page, error was: $1
Showing a range diff from revid $1 to $2
Invalid CSD tag, there is no message and wiki tag to use
There is already a CSD tag on the page.
Error: unable to retrieve report page at $1
Unable to retrieve timestamp of current report page, API failure:\n\n $1
, compiled using QT $1 Running on QT $1
Site didn't return any userinfo information
Invalid registration date returned by mediawiki
Site info query for $1 has failed: $2
No site info was returned for this wiki
The API responded with invalid text (webserver is down?), please check debug log for precise information
You have entered into developer mode!
This feature has not been implemented yet
No reason was provided / custom revert
This edit is already being reverted
You can't revert this edit, because it's already being reverted. Please wait!
made by a user who is on the white list
Query result doesn't contain any data
This edit is $1, so even if it looks like it is a vandalism, it may not be. Are you sure you want to revert it?
No action provided for api request
Login token requires a user defined value, it's not stored in memory
There is nothing else in the queue...

Huggle supports tabs just like any other web browser! If you are on an edit and you want to keep it for later, you can simply open a new tab and continue checking the queue there. The queue is shared amongst all tabs.

Huggle contains an "edit bar", a little widget that contains both the User and Page history in a neat way. It's not enabled by default though. If you are on a small screen, you can replace user and page history widgets with it!
Most preferences are stored on the wiki in [[Special:MyPage/huggle3.css]]. You can also manually change them there.
Almost every widget on screen can be safely closed (except for the navigation bar).
You can use Huggle simultaneously on multiple projects, just click the "Projects" button on login form.
Huggle's reverting can be made much faster if you are experienced user who never make mistakes ;) open preferences and check "Instant Reverts"
You can create your own custom Queue filters in your preferences. They are stored in your on-wiki config page.
Pressing G will flag this edit as a "good edit". This will notify others that this edit can be ignored, decreases user badness score and optionally sends them a welcome message.
Pressing S will flag edit as "suspicious edit". This will notify others that this edit needs attention and adds it to the queue of suspicious edits for later review by experts.
Most of the shortcuts can be changed in your preferences.
Moving a widget on Huggle screen over another widget will merge them into one, separated with tabs.
Made a mistake? No problem, right clicking any edit you made in "History of your edits" opens a popup which offers the option to undo your own change.

You can open a "contribution browser" for the user who created the currently displayed edit, by pressing Shift + C (default) or from the user menu. It allows you to quickly view recent edits made by this user.
You can chat with other active users of Huggle who are using the program right now. You will see them in the "Network" window, if they are online.
